an10.119:1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo tadahuposathe sīsaṃnhāto navaṃ khomayugaṃ nivattho allakusamuṭṭhiṃ ādāya bhagavato avidūre ekamantaṃ ṭhito hoti.
an10.119:1.1.eng: Now, at that time it was the sabbath. The brahmin Jānussoṇi had bathed his head and dressed in a new pair of linen robes. Holding a handful of fresh grass, he stood to one side not far from the Buddha.

an10.119:2.1.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā jāṇussoṇiṃ brāhmaṇaṃ tadahuposathe sīsaṃnhātaṃ navaṃ khomayugaṃ nivatthaṃ allakusamuṭṭhiṃ ādāya ekamantaṃ ṭhitaṃ.

an10.119:2.3.pli: “kiṃ nu tvaṃ, brāhmaṇa, tadahuposathe sīsaṃnhāto navaṃ khomayugaṃ nivattho allakusamuṭṭhiṃ ādāya ekamantaṃ ṭhito?
an10.119:2.3.eng: “Brahmin, why have you bathed your head and dressed in a new pair of linen robes? Why are you standing to one side holding a handful of fresh grass?

an10.119:2.4.eng: What’s going on today with the brahmin clan?”

an10.119:2.5.eng: “Worthy Gotama, today is the ceremony of descent for the brahmin clan.”

an10.119:3.1.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana, brāhmaṇa, brāhmaṇānaṃ paccorohaṇī hotī”ti?
an10.119:3.1.eng: “But how do the brahmins observe the ceremony of descent?”

an10.119:3.2.pli: “Idha, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā tadahuposathe sīsaṃnhātā navaṃ khomayugaṃ nivatthā allena gomayena pathaviṃ opuñjitvā haritehi kusehi pattharitvā antarā ca velaṃ antarā ca agyāgāraṃ seyyaṃ kappenti.
an10.119:3.2.eng: “Well, worthy Gotama, on the sabbath the brahmins bathe their heads and dress in a new pair of linen robes. They make a heap of fresh cow dung and spread it with green grass. Then they make their beds between the boundary and the fire chamber.

an10.119:3.3.pli: Te taṃ rattiṃ tikkhattuṃ paccuṭṭhāya pañjalikā aggiṃ namassanti:
an10.119:3.3.eng: That night they rise three times and worship the fire with joined palms:

an10.119:3.5.eng: And they serve the fire with abundant ghee, oil, and butter.

an10.119:3.6.pli: Tassā ca rattiyā accayena paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena brāhmaṇe santappenti.
an10.119:3.6.eng: And when the night has passed they serve the brahmins with delicious fresh and cooked foods.

an10.119:3.7.pli: Evaṃ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇānaṃ paccorohaṇī hotī”ti.
an10.119:3.7.eng: That’s how the brahmins observe the ceremony of descent.”

an10.119:4.1.pli: “Aññathā kho, brāhmaṇa, brāhmaṇānaṃ paccorohaṇī hoti, aññathā ca pana ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hotī”ti.
an10.119:4.1.eng: “The ceremony of descent observed by the brahmins is quite different from that observed in the training of the Noble One.”

an10.119:4.2.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana, bho gotama, ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hoti?
an10.119:4.2.eng: “But worthy Gotama, how is the ceremony of descent observed in the training of the Noble One?

an10.119:4.3.pli: Sādhu me bhavaṃ gotamo tathā dhammaṃ desetu yathā ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hotī”ti.
an10.119:4.3.eng: Worthy Gotama, please teach me this.”

an10.119:5.1.pli: “Tena hi, brāhmaṇa, suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
an10.119:5.1.eng: “Well then, brahmin, listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

an10.119:5.2.pli: “Evaṃ, bho”ti kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo bhagavato paccassosi.

an10.119:6.3.eng: in both this life and the next.’

an10.119:6.4.eng: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong view,

an10.119:7.2.eng: in both this life and the next.’

an10.119:7.3.eng: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong thought,

an10.119:8.2.eng: in both this life and the next.’

an10.119:8.3.eng: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong speech,

an10.119:9.3.eng: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong action,

an10.119:10.2.eng: in both this life and the next.’

an10.119:10.3.eng: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong livelihood,

an10.119:11.2.eng: in both this life and the next.’

an10.119:11.3.eng: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong effort,

an10.119:12.2.eng: in both this life and the next.’

an10.119:12.3.eng: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong mindfulness,

an10.119:13.2.eng: in both this life and the next.’

an10.119:13.3.eng: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong immersion,

an10.119:14.2.eng: in both this life and the next.’

an10.119:14.3.eng: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong knowledge,

an10.119:15.2.eng: in both this life and the next.’

an10.119:15.3.eng: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong freedom,

an10.119:15.5.pli: Evaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hotī”ti.
an10.119:15.5.eng: This is the ceremony of descent in the training of the Noble One.”

an10.119:16.1.pli: “Aññathā, bho gotama, brāhmaṇānaṃ paccorohaṇī, aññathā ca pana ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hoti.
an10.119:16.1.eng: “The ceremony of descent observed by the brahmins is quite different from that observed in the training of the Noble One.

an10.119:16.2.pli: Imissā ca, bho gotama, ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇiyā brāhmaṇānaṃ paccorohaṇī kalaṃ nāgghati soḷasiṃ.
an10.119:16.2.eng: And, worthy Gotama, the ceremony of descent observed by the brahmins is not worth a sixteenth part of a master of the ceremony of descent observed in the training of the Noble One.

an10.119:16.4.pli: upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
an10.119:16.4.eng: From this day forth, may the worthy Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

an10.12:1.1.pli: “Pañcaṅgavippahīno, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcaṅgasamannāgato imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ‘kevalī vusitavā uttamapuriso’ti vuccati.
an10.12:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in this teaching and training a mendicant who has given up five factors and possesses five factors is called consummate, accomplished, a supreme person.

an10.12:1.2.eng: And how has a mendicant given up five factors?

an10.12:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno kāmacchando pahīno hoti, byāpādo pahīno hoti, thinamiddhaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti, uddhaccakukkuccaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti, vicikicchā pahīnā hoti.
an10.12:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant has given up sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.

an10.12:1.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcaṅgavippahīno hoti.
an10.12:1.4.eng: That’s how a mendicant has given up five factors.

an10.12:2.1.eng: And how does a mendicant have five factors?

an10.12:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu asekhena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekhena samādhikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekhena paññākkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekhena vimuttikkhandhena samannāgato hoti, asekhena vimuttiñāṇadassanakkhandhena samannāgato hoti.
an10.12:2.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant has the entire spectrum of an adept’s ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and knowledge and vision of freedom.

an10.12:2.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcaṅgasamannāgato hoti.
an10.12:2.3.eng: That’s how a mendicant has five factors.

an10.12:3.1.pli: Pañcaṅgavippahīno kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcaṅgasamannāgato imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ‘kevalī vusitavā uttamapuriso’ti vuccati.
an10.12:3.1.eng: In this teaching and training a mendicant who has given up five factors and possesses five factors is called consummate, accomplished, a supreme person.

an10.120:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the noble descent.

an10.120:1.2.eng: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak. …

an10.120:1.3.eng: And what is the noble descent?

an10.120:1.4.eng: It’s when a noble disciple reflects:

an10.120:1.6.eng: in both this life and the next.’

an10.120:1.7.eng: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong view,

an10.120:1.18.eng: in both this life and the next.’

an10.120:1.19.eng: Reflecting like this, they give up wrong freedom,

an10.120:1.21.eng: This is called the noble descent.”

an10.121:1.1.pli: “Sūriyassa, bhikkhave, udayato etaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ etaṃ pubbanimittaṃ, yadidaṃ—aruṇuggaṃ.
an10.121:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the dawn is the forerunner and precursor of the sunrise.

an10.121:1.2.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ etaṃ pubbaṅgamaṃ etaṃ pubbanimittaṃ, yadidaṃ—sammādiṭṭhi.
an10.121:1.2.eng: In the same way right view is the forerunner and precursor of skillful qualities.

an10.121:1.3.pli: Sammādiṭṭhikassa, bhikkhave, sammāsaṅkappo pahoti, sammāsaṅkappassa sammāvācā pahoti, sammāvācassa sammākammanto pahoti, sammākammantassa sammāājīvo pahoti, sammāājīvassa sammāvāyāmo pahoti, sammāvāyāmassa sammāsati pahoti, sammāsatissa sammāsamādhi pahoti, sammāsamādhissa sammāñāṇaṃ pahoti, sammāñāṇissa sammāvimutti pahotī”ti.
an10.121:1.3.eng: Right view produces right thought. Right thought produces right speech. Right speech produces right action. Right action produces right livelihood. Right livelihood produces right effort. Right effort produces right mindfulness. Right mindfulness produces right immersion. Right immersion produces right knowledge. Right knowledge produces right freedom.”

an10.122:1.1.pli: “Dasayime, bhikkhave, dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā āsavānaṃ khayāya saṃvattanti.
an10.122:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these ten things, when developed and cultivated, lead to the ending of defilements.

an10.122:1.3.pli: Sammādiṭṭhi, sammāsaṅkappo, sammāvācā, sammākammanto, sammāājīvo, sammāvāyāmo, sammāsati, sammāsamādhi, sammāñāṇaṃ, sammāvimutti—
an10.122:1.3.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.122:1.4.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, dasa dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā āsavānaṃ khayāya saṃvattantī”ti.
an10.122:1.4.eng: These ten things, when developed and cultivated, lead to the ending of defilements.”

an10.123:1.1.pli: “Dasayime, bhikkhave, dhammā parisuddhā pariyodātā, nāññatra sugatavinayā.
an10.123:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these ten things are not purified and cleansed apart from the Holy One’s training.

an10.123:1.3.pli: Sammādiṭṭhi, sammāsaṅkappo, sammāvācā, sammākammanto, sammāājīvo, sammāvāyāmo, sammāsati, sammāsamādhi, sammāñāṇaṃ, sammāvimutti—
an10.123:1.3.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.123:1.4.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, dasa dhammā parisuddhā pariyodātā, nāññatra sugatavinayā”ti.
an10.123:1.4.eng: These ten things are not purified and cleansed apart from the Holy One’s training.”

an10.124:1.1.pli: “Dasayime, bhikkhave, dhammā anuppannā uppajjanti, nāññatra sugatavinayā.
an10.124:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these ten things don’t arise apart from the Holy One’s training.

an10.124:1.3.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.124:1.4.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, dasa dhammā anuppannā uppajjanti, nāññatra sugatavinayā”ti.
an10.124:1.4.eng: These are the ten things that don’t arise apart from the Holy One’s training.”

an10.125:1.1.pli: “Dasayime, bhikkhave, dhammā mahapphalā mahānisaṃsā, nāññatra sugatavinayā.
an10.125:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these ten things are not very fruitful and beneficial apart from the Holy One’s training.

an10.125:1.3.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.125:1.4.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, dasa dhammā mahapphalā mahānisaṃsā, nāññatra sugatavinayā”ti.
an10.125:1.4.eng: These are the ten things that are not very fruitful and beneficial apart from the Holy One’s training.”

an10.126:1.1.pli: “Dasayime, bhikkhave, dhammā rāgavinayapariyosānā honti dosavinayapariyosānā honti mohavinayapariyosānā honti, nāññatra sugatavinayā.
an10.126:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these ten things don’t culminate in the removal of greed, hate, and delusion apart from the Holy One’s training.

an10.126:1.3.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.126:1.4.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, dasa dhammā rāgavinayapariyosānā honti dosavinayapariyosānā honti mohavinayapariyosānā honti, nāññatra sugatavinayā”ti.
an10.126:1.4.eng: These are the ten things that don’t culminate in the removal of greed, hate, and delusion apart from the Holy One’s training.”

an10.127:1.1.pli: “Dasayime, bhikkhave, dhammā ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattanti, nāññatra sugatavinayā.
an10.127:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these ten things don’t lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment apart from the Holy One’s training.

an10.127:1.3.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.127:1.4.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, dasa dhammā ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattanti, nāññatra sugatavinayā”ti.
an10.127:1.4.eng: These are the ten things that don’t lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment apart from the Holy One’s training.”

an10.128:1.1.pli: “Dasayime, bhikkhave, dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā anuppannā uppajjanti, nāññatra sugatavinayā.
an10.128:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these ten things don’t arise to be developed and cultivated apart from the Holy One’s training.

an10.128:1.3.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.128:1.4.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, dasa dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā anuppannā uppajjanti, nāññatra sugatavinayā”ti.
an10.128:1.4.eng: These are the ten things that don’t arise to be developed and cultivated apart from the Holy One’s training.”

an10.129:1.1.pli: “Dasayime, bhikkhave, dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā honti mahānisaṃsā, nāññatra sugatavinayā.
an10.129:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these ten things when developed and cultivated are not very fruitful and beneficial apart from the Holy One’s training.

an10.129:1.3.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.129:1.4.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, dasa dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā honti mahānisaṃsā, nāññatra sugatavinayā”ti.
an10.129:1.4.eng: These are the ten things that when developed and cultivated are not very fruitful and beneficial apart from the Holy One’s training.”

an10.13:1.3.eng: The five lower fetters and the five higher fetters.

an10.13:1.4.eng: What are the five lower fetters?

an10.13:1.5.eng: Substantialist view, doubt, misapprehension of precepts and observances, sensual desire, and ill will.

an10.13:1.6.eng: These are the five lower fetters.

an10.13:2.1.eng: What are the five higher fetters?

an10.13:2.2.eng: Desire for rebirth in the realm of luminous form, desire for rebirth in the formless realm, conceit, restlessness, and ignorance.

an10.13:2.3.eng: These are the five higher fetters.

an10.130:1.1.pli: “Dasayime, bhikkhave, dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā rāgavinayapariyosānā honti dosavinayapariyosānā honti mohavinayapariyosānā honti, nāññatra sugatavinayā.
an10.130:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these ten things when developed and cultivated don’t culminate in the removal of greed, hate, and delusion apart from the Holy One’s training.

an10.130:1.3.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.130:1.4.eng: These are the ten things that when developed and cultivated don’t culminate in the removal of greed, hate, and delusion apart from the Holy One’s training.”

an10.131:1.3.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.131:1.4.eng: These are the ten things that when developed and cultivated don’t lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment apart from the Holy One’s training.”

an10.132:1.3.pli: Micchādiṭṭhi, micchāsaṅkappo, micchāvācā, micchākammanto, micchāājīvo, micchāvāyāmo, micchāsati, micchāsamādhi, micchāñāṇaṃ, micchāvimutti—
an10.132:1.3.eng: Wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong immersion, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom.

an10.132:1.4.eng: These are the ten wrong ways.”

an10.133:1.3.pli: Sammādiṭṭhi, sammāsaṅkappo, sammāvācā, sammākammanto, sammāājīvo, sammāvāyāmo, sammāsati, sammāsamādhi, sammāñāṇaṃ, sammāvimutti—
an10.133:1.3.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.133:1.4.eng: These are the ten right ways.”

an10.134:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you what is good and what is not good.

an10.134:1.2.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
an10.134:1.2.eng: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

an10.134:1.3.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

an10.134:2.2.pli: Micchādiṭṭhi, micchāsaṅkappo, micchāvācā, micchākammanto, micchāājīvo, micchāvāyāmo, micchāsati, micchāsamādhi, micchāñāṇaṃ, micchāvimutti—
an10.134:2.2.eng: Wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong immersion, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom.

an10.134:2.3.eng: This is called what is not good.

an10.134:2.5.pli: Sammādiṭṭhi, sammāsaṅkappo, sammāvācā sammākammanto, sammāājīvo, sammāvāyāmo, sammāsati, sammāsamādhi, sammāñāṇaṃ, sammāvimutti—
an10.134:2.5.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.134:2.6.eng: This is called what is good.”

an10.135:0.3.eng: The Teaching of the Noble Ones

an10.135:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the teaching of the noble ones, and what is not the teaching of the noble ones. …

an10.135:1.3.eng: And what is not the teaching of the noble ones?

an10.135:1.4.eng: Wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong immersion, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom.

an10.135:1.5.eng: This is called what is not the teaching of the noble ones.

an10.135:1.6.eng: And what is the teaching of the noble ones?

an10.135:1.7.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.135:1.8.eng: This is called the teaching of the noble ones.”

an10.136:1.1.eng: “I will teach you the skillful and the unskillful …

an10.136:1.4.eng: Wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong immersion, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom.

an10.136:1.7.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.137:1.1.eng: “I will teach you the beneficial and the harmful. …

an10.137:1.4.eng: Wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, wrong immersion, wrong knowledge, and wrong freedom.

an10.137:1.7.eng: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.

an10.138:1.1.eng: “I will teach you what is the teaching and what is not the teaching. …

an10.138:1.3.eng: And what is not the teaching?
